title: Apple’s relationship with Dutch fines continues as App Store fails to satisfy regulators
content:
Apple has been fined for the fifth time over the App Store regulation controversy in the Netherlands. The country’s antitrust watchdog is charging the Cupertino company over $5.7 million again – for the fifth week in a row – over the lack of third-party payment options for dating apps subscriptions.

more…

The post Apple’s relationship with Dutch fines continues as App Store fails to satisfy regulators appeared first on 9to5Mac.
description: Apple has been fined for the fifth time over the App Store regulation controversy in the Netherlands regarding dating apps payment options.
